sections.heading: What are Relative Clauses?
sections.content:
Relative clauses in Japanese are phrases that modify nouns, similar to English "who," "which," or "that" clauses. However, Japanese doesn't use relative pronouns - instead, the modifying clause comes directly before the noun in plain form.

私が読んだ本 "The book that I read" 昨日買った服 "The clothes (I) bought yesterday" 彼女が作った料理 "The food that she made"

children.heading: [Plain form clause] + Noun
children.content: [食べる] りんご "An apple (that someone) eats" [赤い] 車 "A red car" Clause comes before noun

children.heading: No relative pronouns needed
children.content: English: The book that I read Japanese: 私が読んだ本 No "that/which/who" Direct modification

children.heading: Identifying which noun
children.content: そこにいる人 "The person who is there" 昨日会った友達 "The friend (I) met yesterday" Specifies particular noun

children.heading: Adding description
children.content: 静かな場所 "A quiet place" 難しい問題 "A difficult problem" Descriptive information

children.heading: Present/Future tense
children.content: 行く人 "A person who goes / will go" 食べる物 "A thing (that someone) eats" Dictionary form

children.heading: Past tense
children.content: 行った人 "A person who went" 食べた物 "A thing (that someone) ate" た-form

children.heading: Negative
children.content: 行かない人 "A person who doesn't go" 食べない物 "A thing (that someone) doesn't eat" ない-form

children.heading: Subject marker が
children.content: 私が読んだ本 "The book that I read" 彼が住んでいる家 "The house where he lives" が marks subject in clause

children.heading: Object marker を
children.content: 私を助けてくれた人 "The person who helped me" Particles stay in clause

children.heading: Location marker で/に
children.content: 私が働いている会社 "The company where I work" 彼が住んでいる町 "The town where he lives" Location markers preserved

children.heading: い-adjectives (plain form)
children.content: 高い山 "A tall mountain" 新しい本 "A new book" Direct modification

children.heading: な-adjectives (drop だ)
children.content: 静かな場所 "A quiet place" 便利な道具 "A convenient tool" な connects to noun

children.heading: Noun is modified element
children.content: 私が読んだ [本] "The [book] that I read" 昨日買った [服] "The [clothes] bought yesterday" Final position

children.heading: Person descriptions
children.content: 日本語を話す人 "A person who speaks Japanese" メガネをかけている人 "A person wearing glasses" Identifying people

children.heading: Place descriptions
children.content: 静かな場所 "A quiet place" 人が多い店 "A store with many people" Describing locations

children.heading: Time expressions
children.content: 彼が来た時 "The time when he came" 雨が降った日 "The day when it rained" Temporal modification

children.heading: Stacking clauses
children.content: 昨日私が買った新しい本 "The new book that I bought yesterday" Multiple modifiers before noun All in plain form

children.heading: Can be different from main subject
children.content: 私は [彼が書いた] 本を読んだ "I read [the book that he wrote]" Main subject: 私 Clause subject: 彼 Two different subjects

children.heading: Context-based omission
children.content: Full: 私が食べたりんご "The apple that I ate" Short: 食べたりんご "The eaten apple" Subject often omitted

children.heading: Relative clauses always plain
children.content: Wrong: 読みました本 ⚠️ Correct: 読んだ本 ✓ "The book (I) read" Always use plain form Politeness in main verb only

children.heading: Main sentence can be polite
children.content: 私が読んだ本はおもしろいです "The book that I read is interesting" (polite) Clause: plain Main verb: polite

children.heading: Introducing topics
children.content: これは私が作った料理です "This is food that I made" あれは彼が住んでいる家です "That is the house where he lives" Identifying things

children.heading: Asking questions
children.content: 誰が書いた本ですか "Whose book is this?" (Lit: A book written by whom?) どこで買った服？ "Where did you buy those clothes?" (Lit: Clothes bought where?) Question words in clauses

children.heading: Making recommendations
children.content: 私がよく行くレストラン "A restaurant I often go to" 友達が教えてくれた方法 "A method my friend taught me" Sharing suggestions

children.heading: 私の vs relative clause
children.content: 私の本 "My book" (I own it) 私が読んだ本 "The book I read" (action relationship) Different relationships

children.heading: Modified by clauses
children.content: 彼が来た時 "The time when he came" 私が住んでいる場所 "The place where I live" Temporal/locational nouns

children.heading: Using です/ます in clause
children.content: Wrong: 読みました本 ⚠️ Correct: 読んだ本 ✓ "The book (I) read" Must use plain form

children.heading: Adding relative pronouns
children.content: Wrong: 私が読んだ that 本 ⚠️ Correct: 私が読んだ本 ✓ No "that/which/who" needed

children.heading: Wrong particle は in clause
children.content: Wrong: 彼は住んでいる家 ⚠️ Correct: 彼が住んでいる家 ✓ "The house where he lives" Use が, not は in relative clauses

children.heading: Using の or もの
children.content: 読んだのは私です "The one who read it is me" 食べたのは彼です "The one who ate it is him" Nominalizing with の

children.heading: Noun + relative clause
children.content: 東京にある大きい店 "A big store that is in Tokyo" 日本語が話せる外国人 "A foreigner who can speak Japanese" Multiple layers

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 私が読んだ本 "The book that I read" 昨日買った服 "The clothes (I) bought yesterday" 彼女が作った料理 "The food that she made" 高い山 "A tall mountain" 静かな場所 "A quiet place"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 私が昨日図書館で借りた本はとても面白い "The book I borrowed at the library yesterday is very interesting" 彼が住んでいるアパートは駅から近い "The apartment where he lives is close to the station" 母が作ってくれた弁当を食べた "I ate the lunch that my mother made for me" 友達が教えてくれたレストランに行った "I went to the restaurant that my friend told me about" 日本語を勉強している人は多い "There are many people studying Japanese"
